metadata.title: Privacy Policy - Finxbridge | Data Protection & Privacy
metadata.description: Learn how Finxbridge collects, uses, and protects your personal information. Our privacy policy outlines our commitment to data security and transparency.

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.subtitle: Your privacy and data security are our top priorities

paragraphs: This Privacy Policy describes how Finxbridge LLP (referred to as "Finxbridge", "we", "us", or "our") collects, uses, stores, and discloses personal information when you visit our website www.finxbridge.com (the "Site") or interact with our products, platforms, APIs, services, or communications.
Finxbridge operates in the areas of fintech platforms, digital lending enablement, co-lending technology, data analytics, compliance solutions, API integrations, and enterprise technology services.

sections.title: Collecting Personal Information
sections.content: When you visit or interact with our Site or services, we collect certain information related to your device, usage, and business interaction with Finxbridge. In this Privacy Policy, "Personal Information" refers to any information that identifies or can reasonably be linked to an individual.

sections.title: Categories of Personal Information We Collect

subsections.title: A. Device & Usage Information
examples: Pages visited, links clicked, referral URLs
purposes: To operate, secure, and optimize our website
To analyze site traffic and improve user experience
To monitor performance, security, and fraud prevention
subsections.source: Automatically collected through cookies, log files, analytics tools, and similar technologies when you access the Site
subsections.disclosure: Shared with trusted analytics, cloud, and security service providers

subsections.title: B. Business & Contact Information
purposes: To respond to enquiries, demos, proposals, and partnership discussions
To communicate about Finxbridge services, products, or events
To manage client, vendor, and partner relationships
subsections.source: Directly collected from you via website forms, emails, calls, or meetings
subsections.disclosure: Shared internally and with authorized service providers strictly on a need-to-know basis

subsections.title: C. Client, Platform & Integration Information
purposes: To deliver fintech platforms, APIs, dashboards, analytics, and integrations
To ensure regulatory compliance, security monitoring, and audit readiness
To improve service reliability and performance
subsections.source: Generated through use of Finxbridge platforms and systems
subsections.disclosure: Shared with regulated financial institutions, auditors, regulators, and infrastructure partners as required by law or contract

sections.title: Sharing of Personal Information
sections.content: We share personal information only where necessary and lawful, including:
items: With cloud infrastructure, analytics, monitoring, and security providers
With banks, NBFCs, regulated entities, and partners for service delivery
To comply with applicable laws, RBI guidelines, court orders, or regulatory requirements
To protect the rights, property, security, and integrity of Finxbridge and its stakeholders
sections.note: We do not sell personal data.

sections.title: Analytics & Communications
sections.content: We use analytics tools (such as Google Analytics or equivalent) to understand how visitors interact with our Site and services.
items: These tools may collect IP address, usage patterns, and browser data
You can opt out of Google Analytics using tools provided by Google
Communications may include service updates, regulatory notices, or business communications

sections.title: Cookies & Tracking Technologies
sections.content: Cookies are small data files stored on your device to enhance website functionality and performance.
sections.note: You may control cookies through your browser settings. Disabling cookies may affect certain site features.

sections.title: Data Retention
sections.content: We retain personal information only for as long as necessary:
items: To fulfill business and contractual obligations
To comply with regulatory and legal requirements
For audit, security, and dispute-resolution purposes

sections.title: Data Security
sections.content: Finxbridge implements industry-standard security practices, including:
items: Access controls
Encryption
Secure cloud infrastructure
Audit logging
Periodic security assessments
sections.note: While no system is completely secure, we continuously improve our safeguards.

sections.title: Do Not Track
sections.content: Currently, there is no uniform standard for responding to "Do Not Track" signals. Accordingly, our data practices do not change based on such signals.

sections.title: Changes to This Privacy Policy
sections.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect:
items: Changes in services
Legal or regulatory updates
Operational improvements
sections.note: The updated version will be posted on this page with a revised "Last Updated" date.

sections.title: Contact Information
sections.content: If you have questions, concerns, or requests regarding this Privacy Policy or your personal data, please contact us at:

cta.title: Have Questions About Our Privacy Policy?
cta.description: We're here to help. Reach out to us for any privacy-related queries.

metadata.title: Cookie Policy - Finxbridge | Cookie Usage & Management
metadata.description: Learn about how Finxbridge uses cookies and similar technologies on our website. Understand what cookies we use and how to manage your preferences.

hero.title: Cookie Policy
hero.subtitle: Understanding how we use cookies to improve your experience

paragraphs: This Cookie Policy explains how Finxbridge LLP ("Finxbridge", "we", "us", or "our") uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit our website www.finxbridge.com (the "Website").
This policy provides you with clear and comprehensive information about the cookies we use and the purposes for using them.

sections.title: What Are Cookies?
sections.content: Cookies are small text files that are placed on your device (computer, smartphone, tablet, etc.) when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.
characteristics: Store small amounts of data on your device
Help websites remember your preferences and actions

cookieTypes.name: Strictly Necessary Cookies
cookieTypes.description: These cookies are essential for the Website to function properly. They enable basic functions like page navigation, access to secure areas, and form submissions.

cookieTypes.name: Performance & Analytics Cookies
cookieTypes.description: These cookies collect information about how visitors use our Website, such as which pages are visited most often and whether error messages are received. This helps us improve the Website's performance.

cookieTypes.name: Functional Cookies
cookieTypes.description: These cookies enable the Website to remember choices you make (such as language preferences or region) and provide enhanced, more personalized features.

cookieTypes.name: Targeting & Marketing Cookies
cookieTypes.description: These cookies may be set through our site by our marketing partners. They may be used to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant content on other sites.

sections.title: Third-Party Cookies
sections.content: In addition to our own cookies, we may use various third-party cookies to report usage statistics and deliver advertising on and through the Website.

services.name: Google Analytics
services.purpose: For website traffic analysis and user behavior insights

services.name: Social Media Platforms
services.purpose: For social sharing and engagement features

services.name: Marketing Tools
services.purpose: For targeted advertising and remarketing campaigns

sections.title: How to Manage Cookies
sections.content: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie rights by setting your preferences in your browser settings.

options.description: Most browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings preferences. You can set your browser to refuse cookies or delete certain cookies.
You can opt out of Google Analytics by installing the Google Analytics Opt-out Browser Add-on or through Google's Ads Settings.

sections.warning: If you choose to block or delete cookies, some features of the Website may not function properly, and your user experience may be affected.

browsers.name: Google Chrome
browsers.path: Settings → Privacy and Security → Cookies and other site data

browsers.name: Mozilla Firefox
browsers.path: Options → Privacy & Security → Cookies and Site Data

browsers.name: Microsoft Edge
browsers.path: Settings → Cookies and site permissions → Manage and delete cookies

sections.title: Updates to This Cookie Policy
sections.content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for legal, operational, or regulatory reasons.
sections.note: We encourage you to review this page periodically for the latest information on our cookie practices.

sections.title: Contact Us
sections.content: If you have any questions about our use of cookies or this Cookie Policy, please contact us:

privacyNotice.title: Your Privacy Matters
privacyNotice.content: At Finxbridge, we respect your privacy and are committed to transparency about how we use cookies and other technologies. We use cookies to enhance your experience, analyze site usage, and assist in our marketing efforts. You can manage your cookie preferences at any time through your browser settings.
